This is a list of features that are exclusive to {{el|ee}}. All comparisons are between {{els|be|ee}}.

== General ==
'''Tutorial worlds'''
* Guide players on in-game navigation, crafting, and placing or breaking blocks.
* Includes the World of Chemistry. Unrelated to the [[Legacy Console Edition tutorial|tutorial world]] found in [[Legacy Console Edition]].

'''Lessons'''
* Downloadable from education.minecraft.net.

'''3D Exporting'''
* Allows players to 3D print their creations in the real world and share them via the now-discontinued Remix 3D.

'''[[File:Classroom Mode.png|32px]] [[Classroom Mode]]'''
* A companion app for ''Minecraft'' that shows a high-level map view of the world, a list of all the students, the ability for a teacher to teleport students, and a chat window to communicate.
* It is provided for educators who may want to observe student activity without being in the game and is not needed for students to play.

'''[[File:Code Connection.png|32px]] [[Code Connection]]'''
* An external application that allows students to code in the Minecraft world.

'''[[Code builder]]'''
* An interface used to program agents and other in-game events using editors.

'''[[Minecraft MakeCode]]'''
* A version of Microsoft MakeCode designed for Minecraft Education.

'''[[Library (Minecraft Education)|Library]]'''
* A list of the most popular educational worlds and content to import and use.

'''Easy Classroom Collaboration'''
* A classroom of up to thirty (30) students can play in a world together with no separate server setup required.
* Students can work together in pairs or groups simply by joining their classmates' world.

'''Simple, Secure sign-in'''
* Individual student and teacher logins with Office 365 Education accounts ensure data privacy & security while playing Minecraft: Education Edition.

== Blocks ==
'''[[File:Chalkboard Slate.png|32px]][[File:Chalkboard Poster.png|32px]][[File:Chalkboard Board.png|32px]] [[Chalkboard]]<ref group="note" name="unobtainable">These blocks and mobs also exist {{in|be}}, but are unobtainable without [[add-ons]], inventory editing, or third-party software</ref>'''
* Allows creators to communicate learning goals, provide additional information and give explicit instructions within the game.
* It comes in three different sizes – Slate (1×1), Poster (2×1), and Board (2×3). Can be edited.

'''[[File:Element Constructor.png|32px]] [[Element Constructor]]<ref group="note" name="bedrock">These blocks and items also exist {{in|bedrock}}, but only in worlds with "Minecraft Education features" enabled.</ref>'''
* It allows the creation of [[elements]] based on their atomic structure with sliders to choose the number of protons, neutrons and electrons.
* There are 118 elements from the periodic table as well as over 400 stable isotopes.

'''[[File:Compound Creator.png|32px]] [[Compound Creator]]<ref group="note" name="bedrock"/>'''
* Add [[elements]] to the grid to create the according [[compound]].
* There are over 30 compounds that can be created with this tool.

'''[[File:Lab Table.png|32px]] [[Lab Table]]<ref group="note" name="bedrock"/>'''
* Allows the creation of items by combining [[elements]] and [[compounds]] in a grid.

'''[[File:Material Reducer.png|32px]] [[Material Reducer]]<ref group="note" name="bedrock"/>'''
* It reduces a [[block]] to its component [[elements]], providing a useful way to explore the elements that make up the real world.
* Since some blocks in ''Minecraft'' do not exist in the natural world, there is a "?" element as a placeholder for fictional elements.

'''[[File:Heat Block.gif|32px]] [[Heat Block]]<ref group="note" name="bedrock"/>'''
* Melts [[snow]] and [[ice]] without producing light.

'''[[File:Underwater TNT.png|32px]] [[Underwater TNT]]<ref group="note" name="bedrock"/>'''
* TNT that can destroy blocks underwater.

'''[[File:Underwater Torch.png|32px]] [[Underwater Torch]]<ref group="note" name="bedrock"/>'''
* [[Torch|Torches]] that can function underwater.

'''[[File:Purple Torch.png|32px]][[File:Blue Torch.png|32px]][[File:Green Torch.png|32px]][[File:Red Torch.png|32px]] [[Colored Torch]]<ref group="note" name="bedrock"/>'''
* Torches that are colored. However, these do not produce colored light.

'''[[File:Hardened Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened White Stained Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Light Gray Stained Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Gray Stained Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Black Stained Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Brown Stained Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Red Stained Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Orange Stained Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Yellow Stained Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Lime Stained Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Green Stained Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Cyan Stained Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Light Blue Stained Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Blue Stained Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Purple Stained Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Magenta Stained Glass.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Pink Stained Glass.png|32px]] [[Hardened Stained Glass]]<ref group="note" name="bedrock"/>'''
* Glass blocks that have a significantly higher [[blast resistance]] and [[hardness]] than standard glass blocks.

'''[[File:Hardened Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened White Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Light Gray Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Gray Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Black Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Brown Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Red Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Orange Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Yellow Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Lime Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Green Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Cyan Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Light Blue Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Blue Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Purple Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Magenta Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]][[File:Hardened Pink Stained Glass Pane.png|32px]] [[Hardened Stained Glass Pane]]<ref group="note" name="bedrock"/>'''
* Pane variants of hardened stained glass blocks.

'''[[File:Hydrogen.png|32px]][[File:Helium.png|32px]][[File:Lithium.png|32px]][[File:Beryllium.png|32px]][[File:Boron.png|32px]][[File:Fluorine.png|32px]][[File:Aluminum.png|32px]][[File:Scandium.png|32px]][[File:Lanthanum.png|32px]][[File:Actinium.png|32px]][[File:Unknown Element.png|32px]] [[Element]]s<ref group="note" name="bedrock"/>'''
* Used for creating compounds.

== Items ==
'''[[File:Portfolio.png|32px]] [[Portfolio]]'''
* Allows students to document the development of their projects.

'''[[File:Photo EE2.png|32px]] [[Photo]]'''
* Contains an in-game screenshot that can be displayed in an item frame or book.

'''[[File:Bleach.png|32px]] [[Bleach]]<ref group="note" name="bedrock"/>'''
* A substitute for white [[dye]].

'''[[File:Ice Bomb.png|32px]] [[Ice Bomb]]<ref group="note" name="bedrock"/>'''
* A projectile that freezes [[water]], similar to the [[Frost Walker]] [[Enchanting|enchantment]].

'''[[File:Super Fertilizer.png|32px]] [[Super Fertilizer]]<ref group="note" name="bedrock"/>'''
* An upgraded form of [[Bone Meal|bone meal]], growing plants instantly.

'''[[File:Antidote.png|32px]][[File:Elixir.png|32px]][[File:Eye Drops.png|32px]][[File:Tonic.png|32px]] [[Medicine]]<ref group="note" name="bedrock"/>'''
